intro: Psephellus schavscheticus, commonly known as the Schavshetik's psephellus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its delicate, umbel-like inflorescence and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
